subject: Technology
title: The Rise of Game Streaming
description: One-minute skill: The Rise of Game Streaming.

hook.text: Why buy a $500 console when you could stream games to any screen, like Netflix for gaming?

buildup.text: Google launched Stadia in 2019, promising to stream AAA games to any Chrome browser.

discovery.text: The technology actually worked. Players could start a game on their phone and continue on their TV.

twist.text: Google shut Stadia down in 2023. Not enough players adopted it, and game selection was thin.

climax.text: Xbox Cloud Gaming and Nvidia GeForce Now continue to push streaming. The idea survives even if Stadia didn't.

punchline.text: Game streaming works in theory. Convincing gamers is the hard part.

quiz.question: What happened to Google Stadia?
options: Google shut it down in 2023 due to low adoption
